addressType.description: Determines if it is a delivery address or return address.
Determines if it is a delivery address or return address.

type.description: Could be data processing / doc management

Transaction History.description: Response containing previous hold transaction information

fileOrDocKey.description: This will send either a filekey or doc key and the history will have to search based on the level selected.

deliveryAddressId.description:
If original address, discriminator will be: "original"
If one time address, discriminator will be: "one-time"

releaseItemsOnHold.description:
0 - Do not release
1 - First Available
2 - Scheduled Release

fileKey.description: Required if at file and group level

transactionId.description: If it was managed, it is a required field. Transaction ID can be "0000234567". So we have to save it as string

transactionUser.description: If it was managed, it is a required field.

transactionDate.description: If it was managed, it is a required field.

action.description: hold, release, purge, route, any (for document search screen)

group.description: Required in case of group level

transactionUser.description: If it was managed, it is a required field.

transactionDate.description: If it was managed, it is a required field.

trackingId.description: Would this be included in the response and if so, what would it be for?  USPS, etc?

ucwId.description: Will be a null if the ucw does not exist.

ruleAssociations.description: This is under discussion, but would make the front end have less calls to make.  Canw e do this?
